8. Save Changes Functionality âŒ FAILED

Component: Save Changes Button

Test Actions: 1. Filled in all form fields with test data 2. Scrolled to â€œSave Changesâ€ button at bottom of form 3. Clicked â€œSave Changesâ€ button

Result: âŒ FAILED - API Error

Error Details: - Error Message Displayed: â€œUnexpected token â€˜<â€™,â€<!DOCTYPE â€œâ€¦ is not valid JSONâ€ - Console Error: Error updating vendor data: SyntaxError: Unexpected token '<', "<!DOCTYPE "... is not valid JSON - HTTP Status: 404 Not Found - API Endpoint: /api/vendor/0

Root Cause Analysis: The error indicates that: 1. The API endpoint is returning HTML (404 error page) instead of JSON 2. The vendor ID being passed to the API is 0 or undefined 3. The backend API endpoint /api/vendor/0 does not exist or is not properly configured 4. The frontend is unable to retrieve the vendor ID correctly

Impact: - Users cannot save their settings changes - This is a CRITICAL BUG that blocks the primary functionality of the Settings page - Data entered by users will be lost

API Errors Detected

Error #1: Failed to Load Vendor Data

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()
@ https://alimas-staging-production.up.railway.app/api/vendor/undefined

Impact: Initial data load fails, form fields remain empty

Error #2: Failed to Save Vendor Data

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()
@ https://alimas-staging-production.up.railway.app/api/vendor/0

Impact: Unable to save form changes

Error #3: Invalid JSON Response

Error updating vendor data: SyntaxError: Unexpected token '<', "<!DOCTYPE "... is not valid JSON

Impact: Application expects JSON but receives HTML error page

Critical Issues Found

ğŸ”´ Issue #1: Unable to Load Vendor Data (CRITICAL)

Severity: Critical
Priority: P0 - Must Fix Immediately
Component: Settings Page Data Loading
Error: HTTP 404 on /api/vendor/undefined

Description: When the Settings page loads, it attempts to fetch vendor data but receives a 404 error. The vendor ID appears to be undefined, indicating that the vendor session/authentication is not properly passing the vendor ID to the API call.

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Login as vendor 2. Navigate to Settings page 3. Observe â€œFailed to load vendor dataâ€ error message

Expected Behavior: - Settings page should load with pre-populated vendor information - API should successfully fetch vendor data using the authenticated vendorâ€™s ID

Actual Behavior: - Red error message displayed: â€œFailed to load vendor dataâ€ - All form fields are empty (no pre-populated data) - API returns 404 error

Recommended Fix: 1. Verify vendor ID is correctly stored in session/authentication context after login 2. Ensure vendor ID is properly passed to the settings page component 3. Fix API endpoint to use correct vendor ID parameter 4. Add error handling and retry logic

ğŸ”´ Issue #2: Unable to Save Settings Changes (CRITICAL)

Severity: Critical
Priority: P0 - Must Fix Immediately
Component: Settings Page Save Functionality
Error: HTTP 404 on /api/vendor/0, Invalid JSON response

Description: When clicking â€œSave Changesâ€ button, the API call fails with a 404 error and returns HTML instead of JSON. The vendor ID being sent is 0, which suggests the vendor ID is not available or defaults to 0.

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Login as vendor 2. Navigate to Settings page 3. Fill in any form fields 4. Click â€œSave Changesâ€ button 5. Observe error message

Expected Behavior: - Form data should be validated - API should save the updated vendor information - Success message should be displayed - Page should update with saved data

Actual Behavior: - Red error message displayed: â€œUnexpected token â€˜<â€™,â€<!DOCTYPE â€œâ€¦ is not valid JSONâ€ - Changes are not saved - API endpoint returns 404 HTML page

Recommended Fix: 1. Fix vendor ID retrieval in save function 2. Ensure API endpoint /api/vendor/{id} exists and is properly configured 3. Return proper JSON responses from API (including error responses) 4. Add input validation before API call 5. Implement proper error handling and user feedback

Recommendations

High Priority (P0 - Critical)

  1. Fix Vendor ID Resolution: Investigate why vendor ID is undefined or 0 in Settings page
  2. Fix API Endpoints: Ensure /api/vendor/{id} endpoints exist for GET and PUT/PATCH operations
  3. Fix API Response Format: Return JSON error responses instead of HTML pages
  4. Add Session Validation: Verify vendor authentication and session data before page load

Medium Priority (P1 - Important)

  1. Add Client-Side Validation: Implement form validation before submission (email format, phone format, required fields)
  2. Add Loading States: Show loading indicators while fetching/saving data
  3. Improve Error Messages: Display more user-friendly error messages
  4. Add Success Feedback: Show success message/toast when changes are saved
  5. Add Unsaved Changes Warning: Warn users if they try to leave page with unsaved changes

Low Priority (P2 - Nice to Have)

  1. Add Autocomplete Attributes: Add appropriate autocomplete attributes to form fields
  2. Optimize CSS Loading: Fix preload CSS warnings
  3. Reduce GoTrueClient Instances: Ensure only one authentication client instance
  4. Add Profile Picture Preview: Show selected image before upload
  5. Add Field-Level Validation: Real-time validation feedback as user types
  6. Add Character Limits: Display character count for text areas
  7. Add Phone Number Formatting: Auto-format phone numbers as user types
  8. Add Tooltips: Add helpful tooltips for each field

Security Observations

  1. Password Field: Not present in Settings page (good - prevents accidental password exposure)
  2. Email Change: No email verification flow observed (should require confirmation)
  3. API Authentication: Need to verify API endpoints require proper authentication
  4. Input Sanitization: Need to verify backend sanitizes inputs to prevent XSS/injection

Accessibility Observations

  1. âœ… Form labels are properly associated with inputs
  2. âœ… Icons are used to enhance visual understanding
  3. âœ… Error messages are displayed prominently
  4. âš ï¸ Missing autocomplete attributes (affects autofill)
  5. âš ï¸ Need to verify keyboard navigation works properly
  6. âš ï¸ Need to verify screen reader compatibility

UI/UX Observations

Positive Aspects âœ…

  1. Clean and modern design
  2. Clear section headings with icons
  3. Consistent field styling
  4. Good use of white space
  5. Logical grouping of related fields
  6. Prominent â€œSave Changesâ€ button
  7. Helpful placeholder text
  8. Error messages are clearly visible

Areas for Improvement âš ï¸

  1. No loading indicator during data fetch
  2. No success confirmation after save
  3. Error messages could be more user-friendly
  4. No indication of required vs optional fields
  5. No visual feedback during save operation
  6. Profile picture upload button could be more prominent

Browser Compatibility

  • Tested On: Chromium (Playwright)
  • Not Tested: Firefox, Safari, Mobile browsers
  • Recommendation: Perform cross-browser testing

Performance Notes

  1. Multiple CSS preload warnings suggest optimization opportunities
  2. Page renders quickly despite API errors
  3. Form interactions are responsive

Conclusion

The ALIMAS Vendor Settings page has a well-designed user interface with all form components functioning correctly for data input. However, the page has critical backend API issues that prevent it from being production-ready:

  1. âŒ Critical: Cannot load existing vendor data (404 error)
  2. âŒ Critical: Cannot save settings changes (404 error, invalid JSON)

Recommendation: DO NOT DEPLOY TO PRODUCTION until API endpoints are fixed and retested.

Estimated Fix Time: - Backend API fixes: 2-4 hours - Testing and verification: 1-2 hours - Total: 3-6 hours
